meanings.definition: Hyponea: Abnormally slow or shallow breathing.
meanings.sent1: During the night, his hyponea caused him to wake up gasping for air.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient with hyponea after noticing his irregular breathing patterns.
meanings.sent3: The hyponea of the sleeping puppy made it look like it was gently sighing in its dreams.
meanings.sent4: The hyponea of the forest was so quiet that even the rustling leaves seemed loud in comparison.
meanings.sent5: The hyponea of the old house was like a soft whisper, barely audible in the stillness of the night.

meanings.definition: Hyponea: A condition characterized by decreased respiratory rate.
meanings.sent1: The patient's hyponea puzzled the doctors as they tried to understand the cause.
meanings.sent2: The study focused on the effects of hyponea on overall health and well-being.
meanings.sent3: The hyponea of the lazy sloth was so slow that it seemed to be in no rush to move at all.
meanings.sent4: In the quiet room, the hyponea of the clock ticking seemed to echo louder than usual.
meanings.sent5: The hyponea of the river flowing gently was a calming sound in the peaceful valley.
